availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Guy (Clark County, Indiana, clerk, farmer, 26th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Clark County, Indiana, clerk, farmer, and soldier. Native of England. Son of William Guy and Mary Guy. Married to Anne E. Briner Guy in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on January 11, 1863. Clerk in Clark County, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as third sergeant, second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain from March 5, 1862, to December 5, 1864. Farmer in Clark County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 394.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819616, p. 271 of 333 of microfilm.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 377.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Clark County, IN, June and July 1863, p. 124.
